content: In case you missed it, a CodinGamer left a comment on your puzzle: https://www.codingame.com/forum/t/community-puzzle-grandmas-serial-keys-puzzle-discussion/207275/2
Thanks everyone! This is my very first puzzle and I am glad that it got approved!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I don't understand why the authors describes the very same operation at one place as "bitwise AND with the number 65535" and at another place as 
"take the remainder of this sum when divided by 65536".
But it doesn't matter.
The puzzle description is clear, puzzle is rather easy, it's almost a CoC.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: The assignment is clearly described and provides step-by-step rules for generating the serial key. It combines string processing with arithmetic and bitwise operations, making it both accessible and technically engaging. The constraints are reasonable and ensure that edge cases are covered. Overall, it is a well-structured problem that balances clarity with challenge.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Straightforward puzzle that tests basic bit manipulation, decimal to hex conversion, and string formatting.

Goal
* I find it odd to include "CodinGame" in the name of the development software, given that this section of the website is free and definitely not behind a paywall. The other gimmicky name, "CodinBot", is interesting enough for the story. Suggest removing "CodinGame" or replacing it with another descriptor e.g. bot, game, puzzle…

* Please change "you new keys" to "your new keys".

* Please change "two stages" to "two parts", since the subsequent text uses "Part 1", "Part 2" and "next part".

* Please format "24346", 65535, 65536, "0x", and optionally 16 as {{constants}}.

* Please remove the quotation marks around "24346" and "0x".

* Third segment: Please delete "of this value".

* Please change "-Last" to "-Final" for consistency.

* Suggest deleting "Note:" and keeping only the following sentence.

Output
* Please include "serial key" in the description.

* Please format the three hyphens in the serial key as {{constants}}.

Constraints
* Please change "The input is always a string with no minimum or maximum length, which" to "[[username]]".

* Please add "English" before "letters".

* "Digits" is a better term than "numbers" when referring to characters. In addition, since the current test cases contain no digits, you can remove the word entirely.

* Please delete the second "constraint", as it describes an output requirement, not an output restriction.

Difficulty
* Please set the difficulty to "Easy" instead of "Medium".

Cases
* Are there specific aspects that each pair of cases is focused on? Each test and its corresponding validator should be similar; currently, it's not obvious whether that is so. Unless there's a reason for the current pairings, please swap Validator 1 and Test 2 so that Pair 1 inputs contain no underscores while Pair 2 inputs do.

* Please change Validator 4 so that the third segment doesn't begin with 0.

* Please add a new pair of cases where the second segment isn't 0000.

* Please add a new pair of cases where the first segment begins with 0.

* Will there be any cases where the length of [[username]] is 1? This could be a special case for the third segment calculation as one is required to add the first and last ASCII values.

Thanks.

For this puzzle, you only really need to follow the orders (and know a bit about bitwise stuff (xor, and, shift)). I would consider this a easy puzzle on the harder side, but you can keep it as medium.

Create a testcase with numbers and more special characters in it.

Thanks for the feedback! Was meant to put this puzzle as a Work In Progress but submitted it ready for evaluation. The special names are only made up, so I decided to keep them (since this is the name of the platform after all). I also added a few special test cases as a challenge. As a moderately experienced developer and this being my first puzzle, I think it's safe to put this puzzle in the "Medium" difficulty. After a couple small fixes, I think it's probably ready now.

General
* You mentioned that you were meant to put this puzzle as a Work In Progress but submitted it ready for evaluation. Please note that you can switch it back to Work In Progress at any time; there is no restriction on doing so.

Cases
* I'd like to reiterate that each test and its corresponding validator should be similar in terms of purpose, focus or input/output characteristics. With that in mind:

* Please revise Validator 3 so that (a) the third segment doesn't begin with 0 and (b) it is more similar to the "All Characters" (test 3). ("flippyfloppyfloopy" doesn’t really represent an "all characters" case.)

* Please revise Validator 4 to use a one-character input, in line with Test 4.

* Please add a new pair of cases where the first segment begins with 0.

Output
* Please include "serial key" in the description.

* Please format the three hyphens in the serial key as {{constants}}.

Constraints
* Please use "English letters" instead of just "letters", as letters from other languages aren't used in the test cases.

* Please replace "numbers" with "digits" when referring to characters.

* Please replace "The input is always a string with no minimum or maximum length, which" with "[[username]]".

Reasons:
(1) CodinGame (CG) doesn't allow empty input, so the minimum has to be 1.

(2) CG also prevents inputs over 10,000 characters, so the maximum length is 10,000.

(3) Very long inputs can cause the second segment to exceed 4 hexadecimal characters, and the statement doesn't explain what to do in such cases. Try [[username]] = "z" repeated 6000 times, for example.

(4) Since [[username]] is already defined as a variable name, it should be reused for clarity.

So, please make the suggested change, and add a separate constraint:
1 ≤ length of [[username]] ≤ 1000

Difficulty
* Please set the difficulty to "Easy" instead of "Medium". "This being your first puzzle" isn't a valid reason to mark it as Medium. While I'm not a moderately experienced developer like you, I've completed over 90% of the puzzles on this platform, and based on my experience this puzzle fits the Easy difficulty level.

Goal
* Please change "-Last" to "-Final" for consistency, as "Final Segment" is used earlier in the text, not "Last Segment".

* You mentioned that "the special names are only made up, so I decided to keep them (since this is the name of the platform after all)".

"CodinGame development software" isn't a made up term; it literally means "development software" by or for CodinGame. Also, in case you don't know, CG does have a software called "CodinGame SDK" (SDK = Software Development Kit) https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/25775/codingame-sdk-documentation/introduction , which is very similar to the name you've "made up". This could cause misunderstanding.

If you insist on keeping the name, please write a clear note that this is purely fictional, similar to your existing well-written note that the puzzle doesn't encourage piracy.

Thanks.
I never knew this, thanks a bunch!
All fixed! What do you think now?
Yes I did! You can check it now!

Many thanks! Just two remaining points:

Cases
* Please add a new pair of cases where the first segment begins with 0.

Difficulty
* I still strongly recommend reclassifying the puzzle as Easy.
Unfortunately, it's impossible for me to reverse-engineer the entire puzzle and somehow find a username that started with 0. Other than that, I think this puzzle is complete. What do you think now?

Here is a possible username: "if:{/RD0SYIZj5| ".
It should generate the key 0F2A-0000-0890-17BA.

I generated this using the following Python program (had to re-run it a few times to get a valid output). Feel free to re-roll if you want a different username:

from random import choice
target = 20480
chrs = 16
mean = target // (chrs * chrs)
lst = [choice(range(32 - mean, 128 - mean)) for _ in range(chrs - 1)]
lst.append(sum(lst))
print(lst)
print(''.join(chr(mean + offset) for offset in lst))

chrs is the desired length of the username. The target is set to 20480 = 0x5000 since 24346 = 0x51FA. Bitwise-XORing the two values necessarily yields a value that begins with 0 in the first segment.
Thanks @User123. Yes, a random generator will help generate user names of required attributes. You can also use a while-loop to keep rolling until it generates the user names wanted.
Cool, I never knew that. Thanks friends!
All finished! (I just realized User created a random script  after making my own)
